definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: I've broken my kneels, but not my head.
sentences.chinese: 不過我膝蓋摔壞了，腦袋可沒有壞。

sentences.english: One day-he slipped and hurt his leg.
sentences.chinese: 有一天他滑倒，把腿摔壞了。

sentences.english: He scrambled widely to pick up the broken glasses before his guests could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他手忙腳亂地去揀摔壞了的眼鏡片，免得讓客人看見。

sentences.english: To be frank, I'm the one who broke your watch.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，是我摔壞了你的手錶。

sentences.english: It was no accident that he broke my glasses. He did it on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 他摔壞我的眼鏡並非出於意外，他是故意的。

sentences.english: He has broken his leg and therefore he can't walk.
sentences.chinese: 他摔壞了腿，因此不能走路了。

sentences.english: The old lady fell down in the street and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 老婦跌倒在大街上，摔壞了腿。

sentences.english: If you drop an incandescent bulb and break the filament, it’s done.
sentences.chinese: 如果你摔壞白熾燈的燈絲，它便無法使用了。

sentences.english: Like the machine broke, shen Qiang said her own will fix, this let qin day very surprised.
sentences.chinese: 像機摔壞了，沈薔說她自已會修，這讓秦天很詫異。

sentences.english: Job of staff of a few pinchbeck remove furniture is coarse, throw bad furniture electric equipment.
sentences.chinese: 一些冒牌搬場人員工作粗糙，摔壞傢俱電器。

sentences.english: She picked up the mug, thankfully unbroken , and proceeded to pour the tea.
sentences.chinese: 好在杯子沒有摔壞，她拾起它來往裏面倒茶。

sentences.english: And after that fall he had right here last year when he broke his knee.
sentences.chinese: 而且去年他就是在這裏把膝頭摔壞的呀。

definition: (usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
dichlorvos C4H7Cl2PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide (loanword)/also called dimethyl dichloro-vinyl phosphate DDVP
